Vocabulary.title: 開 - To Open
Vocabulary.content:
Japanese has four different "opens" — 開あける, 開あく, 開ひらける and 開ひらく. ![open](https://files.tofugu.com/articles/japanese/2021-08-24-akeru-aku-hirakeru-hiraku/akeru-aku-hirakeru-hiraku-visual-difference.jpg) Simply speaking, the ones with あ ( 開あける, 開あく) are used to describe versions of "open" that result in a vacant physical space, such as making a hole in an object. On the other hand, the ones with ひら ( 開ひらける and 開ひらく) describe "open" in a more three-dimensional way, like when spreading out or unfolding something. ![open2](https://files.tofugu.com/articles/japanese/2021-08-24-akeru-aku-hirakeru-hiraku/window-door.jpg)

Although the difference is subtle here, the same concepts still apply. That is, 開あく simply indicates space is being created by removing an obstacle (the door). On the other hand, 開ひらく's focus is more on the trajectory of the door movement, which results in the creation of an opening.

Hence, when talking about sliding doors, 開あく is more suitable because it doesn't involve any physical "unfolding" movement. If you use 開ひらく instead, it could sound as though the space on the other side of the door has been revealed to you. It could show your excitement to see the path or space beyond the doorway once it's been revealed. Source: https://www.tofugu.com/japanese/akeru-aku-hirakeru-hiraku/
